com.epoch.genericQTypes

Class TableQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.genericQTypes.TableQ
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TableQConstants, XMLConstants

    public final class TableQ
extends Object
implements TableQConstants
    Class for the complete-the-table question type.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean[][] disabled
      Parallel array of arrays denoting whether the input cells are disabled.

      Response that has been parsed into an array of arrays.

        private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • parseXML

        private boolean parseXML(Node node)
        Converts a node derived from XML into the table. The parser will convert CERs in the XML into the corresponding Unicode characters.
        Parameters:
        node - node derived from XML describing this table
        Returns:
        true if the XML was parsed successfully

      • parseRowsXML

        private void parseRowsXML(NodeList nodeList)
        Converts a nodelist derived from XML into the table. The parser will convert CERs in the XML into the corresponding Unicode characters.
        Parameters:
        nodeList - nodeList derived from XML describing this table

      • parseCellsXML

        private void parseCellsXML(NodeList nodeList,
                           int rowNum)
        Converts a nodelist of cells derived from XML into the table. The parser will convert CERs in the XML into the corresponding Unicode characters.
        Parameters:
        nodeList - nodeList of cells derived from XML describing this table
        rowNum - current 1-based row number

      • parseOldFormat

        private void parseOldFormat(String response)
        Parses a response to a table question that's in the old, non-XML format. Obsolete when we migrate to a database with no table questions.
        Parameters:
        response - the response in the old format

      • convertToDebugPrint

        Converts an unparsed, old-format response to a complete-the-table question to a form that is easier to read in the log.
        Parameters:
        resp - an old-format, unparsed response to a complete-the-table question
        Returns:
        the unparsed response in an easier-to-read format

      • convertToHTML

        public String convertToHTML(QDatum[] qData,
                            boolean chemFormatting,
                            int outputType)
                     throws ParameterException
        Converts the parsed response to a complete-the-table question into HTML.
        Parameters:
        qData - the question qData; they contain row and column captions
        chemFormatting - whether to use chemistry formatting of captions
        outputType - display-only, disable some boxes, include checkboxes to indicate whether to disable
        Returns:
        the parsed response as an HTML table
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if there aren't enough question data to construct the HTML table

      • convertToHTMLInput

        public String convertToHTMLInput(QDatum[] qData,
                                 boolean chemFormatting,
                                 boolean allCellsEditable)
                          throws ParameterException
        Converts the parsed response to a complete-the-table question into HTML for input.
        Parameters:
        qData - the question qData; they contain row and column captions
        chemFormatting - whether to use chemistry formatting of captions
        allCellsEditable - whether table is being constructed for a question author
        Returns:
        the parsed response as an HTML table
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if there aren't enough question data to construct the HTML table

      • convertToHTMLInput

        public String convertToHTMLInput(QDatum[] qData,
                                 boolean chemFormatting,
                                 boolean allCellsEditable,
                                 String colorCellsStr)
                          throws ParameterException
        Converts the parsed response to a complete-the-table question into HTML for input.
        Parameters:
        qData - the question qData; they contain row and column captions
        chemFormatting - whether to use chemistry formatting of captions
        allCellsEditable - whether disabled cells should be made editable; true when authoring a preload table
        colorCellsStr - cells whose background to color, as semicolon-separated list of row:column (1-based)
        Returns:
        the parsed response as an HTML table
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if there aren't enough question data to construct the HTML table

      • getColumnsDisabled

        private boolean[] getColumnsDisabled()
        Determines whether all cells in a table column are disabled.
        Returns:
        array of booleans, each true if the corresponding column contains only disabled values

      • getColorCells

        private void getColorCells(boolean[][] colorCells,
                           String colorCellsStr)
        Converts a string containing 0-based row and column numbers of cells to color into a two-dimensional boolean array.
        Parameters:
        colorCells - 2D array of booleans to fill
        colorCellsStr - cells whose background to color, as semicolon-separated list of row:column (1-based)

      • populateCell

        private void populateCell(StringBuilder out,
                          int rowNum,
                          int colNum,
                          boolean columnDisabled,
                          boolean allCellsEditable,
                          boolean partOfResp,
                          boolean colorBackground)
        Adds the HTML for a table cell to the growing StringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        out - the StringBuilder
        rowNum - 1-based row number of cell
        colNum - 1-based column number of cell
        columnDisabled - whether all cells in the column are disabled
        allCellsEditable - whether this table is being created for an author (all cells should be editable) or a question-solver (some may not)
        partOfResp - whether this cell is part of a student's response or has to be added to a smaller table because the author specifies a larger table
        colorBackground - whether to color the cell's background

      • convertToHTMLDisplay

        public String convertToHTMLDisplay(QDatum[] qData,
                                   boolean chemFormatting)
                            throws ParameterException
        Converts the parsed response to a complete-the-table question into HTML for display only.
        Parameters:
        qData - the question qData; they contain row and column captions
        chemFormatting - whether to use chemistry formatting of captions
        Returns:
        the parsed response as an HTML table
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if there aren't enough question data to construct the HTML table

      • convertToHTMLDisplay

        public String convertToHTMLDisplay(QDatum[] qData,
                                   boolean chemFormatting,
                                   boolean general)
                            throws ParameterException
        Converts the parsed response to a complete-the-table question into HTML for display only.
        Parameters:
        qData - the question qData; they contain row and column captions
        chemFormatting - whether to use chemistry formatting of captions
        general - true if creating for general display (as opposed to author-only)
        Returns:
        the parsed response as an HTML table
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if there aren't enough question data to construct the HTML table

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object theOther)
        Determines whether two parsed responses to a complete-the-table question are equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        theOther - the other parsed response to a complete-the-table question
        Returns:
        true if every trimmed cell value is equal to the trimmed value in the corresponding cell in the other parsed response

        public int hashCode()
        Creates a hash code describing this object.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        the hash code

      • responseToXML

        public static String responseToXML(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Converts the individual values of textboxes from the front end into a single XML string. Values are subjected to inputToCERs().
        Parameters:
        request - holds the values of the textboxes
        Returns:
        table in XML format; non-ASCII characters are converted to CERs, as are <, >, ", ', and & when it is not followed by #\d+.

      • responseToXML

        public static String responseToXML(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                   boolean urisEncoded)
        Converts the individual values of textboxes from the front end into a single XML string. Values are subjected perhaps to urisToText(), always to inputToCERs().
        Parameters:
        request - holds the values of the textboxes
        urisEncoded - true if the text was subjected to encodeURIComponent() before being submitted; if so, subject to urisToText() before inputToCERs()
        Returns:
        table in XML format; non-ASCII characters are converted to CERs, as are <, >, ", ', and & when it is not followed by #\d+.

      • startTable

        private static StringBuilder startTable(String numRowsStr,
                                        String numColsStr)
        Starts the table XML.
        Parameters:
        numRowsStr - number of rows in the table
        numColsStr - number of columns in the table
        Returns:
        the tag and attributes wrapped in < >

        Wraps a tag and attributes with < >.

      • makeCellNode

        private static StringBuilder makeCellNode(boolean isDisabled,
                                          String text)
        Surround the given text with the given XML tags. Don't use XMLUtils.makeNode() to make this node because we don't want to apply toValidXML().
        Parameters:
        isDisabled - whether the disabled attribute should be included
        text - the text of the node
        Returns:
        the text surrounded by XML tags

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the tag wrapped in </ >
